All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
App
This is the main class for the application.
AppForTestingLocal
JavaFX App
Card
This class represents a generic card.
CardClient
Represents a card in the client-side view of the game.
CardIsPositioned
This class represents a server message that shows the position of a card to the client.
CardPositionException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when there is an issue with the positioning of a card, related to points coordinates.
CardToBeDrawn
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the card to be drawn by the user.
CardToBePositioned
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the card to be positioned by the user.
ChosenObjectiveCard
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the objective card chosen by the user.
ChosenStartingCardSide
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the side of the starting card chosen by the user.
ClientMessage
This abstract class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server.
ClientRMI
The ClientRMI class implements the RMIClientInterface and NetworkClient interfaces and provides the functionality for a client to communicate with a server over RMI connection.
ClientSocket
The ClientSocket class implements the NetworkClient interface and provides the functionality for a client to communicate with a server over a socket connection.
ClosingLobbyException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when a user tries to join a lobby that is already closed, or the input fot number of players is incorrect.
Color
This enum represents the colors that can be used in the application.
ColorAlreadyTakenException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when a user tries to choose a color that is already taken by another player.
ColorChosen
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the color chosen by the user.
ConnectionClient
The ConnectionClient class extends ClientMessage and represents a client message specific for managing connections to the server.
ConnectionClientForServer
The ConnectionClientForServer class extends ClientMessage and represents a client message specific for managing connections to the server from the server's perspective.
ConnectionServer
The ConnectionServer class extends ServerMessage and represents a server message specific for managing connections to the server.
ConnectionServerForClient
The ConnectionServerForClient class extends ServerMessage and represents a server message specific for managing connections to the server from the client's perspective.
Controller
The Controller class is responsible for managing the game flow and interactions between the model and the view.
Controller
This class represents the main controller of the game.
Corner
This enum represents the corners of a square in the application.
Countable
This enum represents the countable items in the application.
Deck
This class represents the deck of cards.
EndgameHandler
Class responsible for the handling of the GUI components that are used to display the final results of a finished game.
ErrorMessage
This class represents an error message that can be sent from the server to a client.
ErrorType
This enumeration represents the types of errors that can occur in the application.
FirstPlayer
This class represents a server message that shows the first player to the client.
GameMaster
The GameMaster class represents the main game logic in the application.
GameState
The GameState enum represents the different states that the game can be in.
GiveSecretObjectiveCards
This class represents a server message that gives the secret objective cards to the client.
GoldCard
This class represents a gold card.
GUI
This is the main GUI class for the application.
Kingdom
The Kingdom enum represents the different types of kingdoms that a card can belong to in the game.
LittleModel
The LittleModel class is responsible for maintaining a simplified version of the game model in server.
loadSavedGame
loadSavedGame is a class created to manage the message that communicates to the client that the game is starting with a saved game.
Lobby
The Lobby class represents a lobby where players can join before the game starts.
LobbyCompleteException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when a user tries to join a lobby that is already closed.
LobbyIsReady
This class represents a server message that indicates whether the lobby is ready or not.
LoginController
Controller Class responsible for the handling of the GUI components that are used and updated during the LoginPhase of the game.
LoginMessage
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server during the login process.
MatchController
Controller Class responsible for the handling of the GUI components that are used and updated during the PlayingPhase of the game.
Message
This abstract class represents a message that can be sent over the network.
NetworkClient
The NetworkClient interface represents the contract for a network client in the application.
NetworkHandler
This class is the controller of the network part of the server.
NetworkPlug
The NetworkPlug interface defines the methods that are used for network communication in the game.
NetworkServerSocket
Represents the server-side socket in the network communication.
NoNameException
This exception is thrown when the model doesn't know the name of a player.
NotEnoughResourcesException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when a user tries to perform an action that requires more resources than the user has.
NoTurnException
This exception is thrown when the player cannot perform an action since is not his/her turn.
NumberOfPlayersMessage
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server indicating the number of players in the game.
ObjectiveCard
This class represents an objective card.
ObjectiveCardChosen
This class represents a server message that indicates the objective card chosen by the client.
ObjectiveType
The ObjectiveType enum represents the different types of objectives that an ObjectiveCard can have in the game.
OtherPlayerBoardController
Controller Class responsible for showing the board of another player during the PlayingPhase of the game.
Phase
The Phase enum represents the different phases that a player can have in the game.
PlayableCard
This class represents a playable card.
PlayedCard
The class is used to represent the card placed onto the board, it's role is to keep track of the moves that a player makes during the match *@author Arturo
Player
This is the entity of player.
PlayersAndColorPins
This class represents a server message that contains a map of players and their associated color pins.
ReceivedChatMessage
This class represents a chat message received from a client.
RefreshedPoints
This class represents a server message that updates the points of a player.
RefreshedResources
This class represents a server message that updates the resources of a player.
ResourceCard
This class represents a resource card.
RMIClientInterface
The RMIClientInterface interface defines the methods that are used for network communication in the game.
RMIServerInterface
The RMIServerInterface interface defines the methods that are used for network communication in the game.
SameNameException
This class represents an exception that is thrown when a user tries to create a new player with a name that is already taken.
SentChatMessage
This class represents a client message that is sent from the client to the server containing a chat message from the user.
ServerMessage
This abstract class represents a server message that can be sent over the network.
ServerRMI
The ServerRMI class implements the RMIServerInterface and NetworkPlug interfaces.
ShowHand
This class represents a server message that shows the hand to the client.
ShowHiddenHand
This class represents a server message that shows the hidden hand to the client.
ShowNewTable
This class represents a server message that shows a new table to the client.
ShowObjectiveCards
This class represents a server message that shows the objective cards to the client.
ShowPointsFromObjectives
This class represents a server message that shows the extra points from objectives to the client.
ShowRanking
This class represents a server message that shows the ranking of players to the client.
ShowStartingCard
This class represents a server message that shows the starting card to the client.
ShowTable
This class represents a server message that shows the table state to the client.
Sign
The Sign enum represents the different types of signs that can be present on a card in the game.
SpecialGoldCard
This class represents a special gold card (A gold card that gives points based on counting something like the number of resources the player has at that moment).
StartingCard
This class represents a starting card.
StatusLogin
This class represents a status message sent from the server to a client during the login phase.
StopGaming
This message is used to stop the game for a client since other players have stop gaming (voluntarily, or they lost the connection).
StopWaitingOrDisconnect
This class represents a server message that indicates whether the client should stop waiting or disconnect.
TUI
This class represents the Text User Interface (TUI) of the game.
TurnInfo
This class represents a server message that provides information about the current turn in the game.
TurnType
The TurnType enum represents the different stages of a turn in the game.
ViewInterface
This interface defines the methods that a View in the MVC pattern should implement.
ViewSubmissions
This class is responsible for handling the submissions from the view to the controller.
WrongGamePhaseException
This exception is thrown when the player tries to perform an action that is not allowed in the current game phase.
